Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay This Hotel was the ideal place to stay, my son was in the Hospital within walking distance, they have a resturant I think on the first floor where you will find student doctors and nurses, it is located within walking distance to a Wall Green, Supermarket and other stores, just about $8. by taxi to a large Plaza Las Americas, I love it so much that whenever I return to PR for shopping i returned there and enjoy a pleasant rest, what elese would you expect it is on the Compound of a Hospital.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico's Ronald McDonald House! Okay, we deserved it, we took the bump from the airlines for the voucher, night before Easter and the airline would put us up. Cab drivers couldn't find this place, it is on the 4th floor of the cardiac care unit at the University Hospital. Problem was there were no hotels rooms in San Juan that nite (or at least the ones we called and that the airline did). 3 People, (2 adults and teenage son) we got a room with one double bed, they knew there were 3 of us. but eventually got a rollaway, which barely fit in the room.Spartan to say the least, but perfect if you have a relative having heart surgery there.Believe me, it wasn't worth the airline vouchers.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Absolute Worst Oh my goodness, this place is a HOSPITAL! They don't tell you that it is but its an actual hospital. Its located in the 4th floor and while ur in the elevator, you actually ride it with doctors and patients. It is so terrible. Its in the middle of nowhere where you cant go anywhere without a car or taking a cab. Its the worst.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: don't stay here unless you're desperate Unless you're desperate, don't stay here! The staff is rude and the amenities are zilch. This is really a hospital hotel -- really for those who have relatives who are hospitalized. For this purpose, it's fine. Otherwise, don't stay here! There are no restaurants (other than fast food) within walking distance, nor is there public transportation that is easily accessible. Stay in Old San Juan if you want to really experience Puerto Rico!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
